questions.question: What does DNS stand for and what is its function?
options: Dynamic Name System — manages IP addresses dynamically
Domain Name System — translates domain names to IP addresses
Digital Network Service — encrypts domain requests
Data Navigation System — routes network packets

questions.question: What HTTP status code indicates a successful GET request?
options: 201 Created
404 Not Found
200 OK
301 Moved Permanently

questions.question: What is a JavaScript closure?
options: A function that throws an error when called
A function that retains access to its enclosing scope after that scope has exited
A method for closing browser windows
An ES6 class with private properties

questions.question: What does REST stand for in web development?
options: Remote Execution State Transfer
Representational State Transfer
Reliable Endpoint Service Technology
Request-Response System Template

questions.question: What is the purpose of React's useEffect hook?
options: To define component styles
To perform side effects in function components (data fetching, subscriptions, DOM mutations)
To replace Redux for state management
To create reusable CSS animations

questions.question: What does ACID stand for in database transactions?
options: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability
Automated, Consistent, Indexed, Distributed
Asynchronous, Committed, Integrated, Durable
Atomic, Concurrent, Isolated, Dynamic

questions.question: What is the primary defence against SQL injection attacks?
options: Encrypting the database
Using parameterised queries / prepared statements
Storing passwords as MD5 hashes
Blocking all POST requests

questions.question: What is the CAP theorem?
options: A theorem about CPU capacity planning
A distributed system can guarantee at most two of: Consistency, Availability, and Partition Tolerance
A security principle for API design
A CSS naming convention framework

questions.question: What does 'containerisation' with Docker primarily solve?
options: JavaScript memory leaks
Ensuring consistent environments across development, staging, and production
Real-time database synchronisation
Browser compatibility issues

questions.question: What are Core Web Vitals?
options: Vital signs of a server's CPU usage
Google's metrics for measuring user experience: LCP, FID/INP, and CLS
Security headers for web applications
Database performance benchmarks

questions.question: What is the SOLID principle of 'Single Responsibility'?
options: Every database table has a single primary key
A class or module should have only one reason to change
All API endpoints handle a single HTTP method
Functions should have a single return statement

questions.question: What is OAuth 2.0?
options: A database encryption protocol
An authorisation framework enabling third-party applications to obtain limited access to user accounts
A JavaScript testing framework
A CSS preprocessor standard

questions.question: What does 'lifting state up' mean in React?
options: Moving component state to a Redux store
Moving shared state to the nearest common ancestor component
Upgrading a class component to a function component
Using React.memo to optimise rendering

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of database indexing?
options: Reducing storage space
Speeding up data retrieval queries
Enforcing data validation rules
Enabling full-text search in all databases

questions.question: What is continuous integration (CI)?
options: Running integration tests manually before each deployment
Frequently merging code into a shared repository with automated builds and tests
Continuously monitoring production servers
Integrating multiple databases into one

questions.question: What does the Express middleware chain execute when 'next()' is called?
options: It terminates the request-response cycle
It passes control to the next middleware function in the stack
It sends a 200 OK response
It logs the request to the console

questions.question: What is prototypal inheritance in JavaScript?
options: A Java-style class inheritance system
Every object has a [[Prototype]] chain and inherits properties from it
A TypeScript feature for interface implementation
The way ES6 classes extend base classes

questions.question: What is test-driven development (TDD)?
options: Writing all tests after the feature is complete
Writing a failing test first, then minimal code to pass it, then refactoring
A testing methodology that only uses integration tests
Automated performance testing in production

questions.question: What is an API gateway in microservices architecture?
options: A database that stores API tokens
A single entry point for all clients that handles routing, authentication, and rate limiting
A tool for automatically generating API documentation
A message queue for async service communication

questions.question: What is the Event Loop in Node.js?
options: A loop that runs all JavaScript code synchronously
A mechanism that processes a call stack, web APIs, microtask queue, and macrotask queue to handle async operations
A built-in module for creating web servers
A pattern for managing database connections
